info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 30 at 5:20AM CDT until June 30 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is likely ongoing.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Jewell and Smith.
* WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations, including rural county roads, is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 512 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that areas of light rain remained over the Warning area, but that flooding is likely ongoing or imminent due to a widespread 3 to 5 inches of heavy rain that fell earlier this morning. Much of this heavy rain fell directly over the White Rock Creek basin, and it is quite possible that the gage along the White Rock Creek near Burr Oak will exceed its flood stage of 15 feet at some point this morning.
- This includes the following streams and drainages... Burr Oak Creek, Limestone Creek, White Rock Creek, Cora Creek and Oak Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Lebanon, Burr Oak, Esbon, Webber, Bellaire and Lovewell State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY
